intro: [WRONG START] Embilia oleoides, commonly known as the Indian gooseberry or amla, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are rich in vitamin C and other antioxidants. Its botanical features include a woody stem, simple leaves with entire margins, and a unique aromatic scent. It is often cultivated for its medicinal and nutritional properties.
